title: South Africa Interest Rate
description: The benchmark interest rate in South Africa was last recorded at 6.25 percent. Interest Rate in South Africa averaged 11.97 percent from 1998 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 23.99 percent in June of 1998 and a record low of 3.50 percent in July of 2020. In South Africa, the interest rates decisions are taken by the South African Reserve Bankâ€™s Monetary Policy Committee (MPC). The official interest rate is the repo rate. This is the rate at which central banks lend or discount eligible paper for deposit money banks, typically shown on an end-of-period basis. This page provides - South Africa Interest Rate - actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
author: South African Reserve Bank
